page.title: 15LOCAL NEWS IN WEST STROUD
page.content: The main news story of 1985 in the local newspaper, the Stroud News and Journal, is the story of the meningitis outbreak amongst young children in the area. The new cases have brought the total number to more than 50 since 1980. Several kind of meningitis have affected children with 35 of the cases being severe meninococcal meningitis. Doctors have not traced a common root cause to the outbreak of the disease but investigations are still being carried out by Stroud Council's Health Committee. The happiest local news story of 1985 is the Â£6,000 raised by the local newspaper for the Ethiopian Appeal.
